key_insight: A lightweight multi-scale attention framework (LMSF-A) enables accurate, real-time instance segmentation in challenging spinal endoscopy scenes while remaining stable under small-batch (even batch-1) training and constrained surgical hardware.
problem_solved: Addresses real-time instance segmentation in spinal endoscopy despite narrow field-of-view, specular highlights, smoke/bleeding, unclear boundaries, large scale variation, and strict compute/memory limits of surgical devices.
method: Design a compact backbone with multi-scale attention modules to capture fine details and large-scale context efficiently.
Fuse scale-aware feature maps and a specialized instance segmentation head optimized for low latency on surgical hardware.
Training and inference strategies (normalization and memory/speed optimizations) to ensure stability and accuracy under small-batch or batch-1 regimes.
impact: Enables practical deployment of robust, low-latency instance segmentation in operating rooms, guiding safer surgical navigation and informing ML practitioners how to balance accuracy, speed, and stability for resource-constrained medical applications.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: LMSF-A architecture showing lightweight backbone → multi-scale attention blocks → feature fusion → instance head
Before/after example overlays: raw endoscopic frame vs. instance segmentation with attention heatmaps
Latency vs. accuracy chart: comparing LMSF-A to baseline models on speed (ms/frame) and mAP
Icon set: threats in endoscopy (specular highlights, smoke/bleeding, narrow FOV) mapped to model mitigations
paper_title: A Lightweight Multi-Scale Attention Framework for Real-Time Spinal Endoscopic Instance Segmentation
paper_authors: Qi Lai, JunYan Li, Qiang Cai, Lei Wang, Tao Yan
